newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China's Yue Xiu Enterprises to set $100 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: China's Yue Xiu Enterprises to set $100 mln loan.

text.p: A US$100 million term loan facility for Yue Xiu Enterprises Holdings Ltd is expected to be launched next week, bankers said on Tuesday.
The facility has a final maturity of five years. Repayment is in seven unequal semi-annual instalments after two years' grace. The average life of the loan is 3.95 years.
The loan pays an interest margin of 137.5 basis points over the six-month London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR).
The deal is secured by a "letter of comfort" from the Guangzhou Municipal Commission of Foreign Economic Relations and Trade.
Proceeds are to be used for general working capital.
Societe Generale Asia is the mandated arranger. An arranger group is being formed, bankers said.
